2 Bobcats 
All-LSC 

SAN MARCOS - The league’s Most Valuable 
Player and two players each from loop champion 
E ast T exas State and 
Southwest T exas State comprise the 1977 Lone 
Star Conference basket­ ball team. 
Howard Payne forward 
David Harrison received 
H") of a possible 79 points in b a llo tin g by loot: coaches and was named the league’s MVP. He led the conference in scoring 
(23.8) and free-throw shooting (.841). 
New .Jersey native.- 
Nate Granger and Larr> 
McGhee of East Texas are on the all-star team as are guard .Jeff Frnkc and center Steve Front/ of Southwest Texas.

SAN ANTONIO E X P R E S S — Thursday March 31977 
O’Brien raps NBA violence 

Continued from Page IG concern was evident in his memo. 
“ During the last several w eeks,” he said, “ there has been a disturbing in­ crease in the num ber of league rule v io la tio n s involvin g u nprovoked punching and other fla g ra n t fouls, player movements from the vicinity of the bench during fights on the playing floor and abusive behavior directed at officials. 
“ All players are to be advised of the following: 
“ I. Any player who without provo­ cation intentionally engages in punch­ ing or fighting or com m its any form of flagrant foul, will be m et with stern m easu res from the co m m issio n er’s office. Such actions simply can not be condoned. 
“ 2. Any player reported by the offi­ cial to have left the vicinity of the bench d uring an altercatio n on the floor, shall autom atically be fined $15o. 
Those who becom e em broiled in se­ condary fights and any repeating of­ fenders are subject to m ore sev ere p e n a ltie s. W hen a fight e ru p ts th e peacem aker function rests solely with the respective head coaches. 
“ 3. Upon being ejected from the game any player or coach w ho engages in excessive dem onstrative behavior is 

 subject to a su b stan tial fine and-or period of suspension. 
“ 4. Any player or coach guilty of intentional physical contact with an official shall autom atically he sus­ pended without pay for one gam e. A fine an d -o r a lo n g er p erio d of suspension will also result if circum ­ stances dictate.” 

T here were varying views of w hat one owner called “ one of worst seasons of player fights in league history.” 
Herb Brown, the Piston coach, said by telephone from D e tro it, “ They seem to allow so much hand checking and have an inconsistent approach to how they call it. There are also a lot of people who condone banging people with forearm s off the ball. Many tim es the officials are looking at the ball and 

 they don’t see the other pushing and shoving that goes on. 
“ Many of the fights occur by the frustration of constantly being pushed around. T hat’s evident in the disparity in the fouls and the num ber of tim es a team goes to the free throw line. The offenses have become so sophisticated, and there is so much movement away from the ball, and that creates prob­ lems for the defense. Players are also frustrated that some team s are being perm itted to use zone defenses.” 
.lim M cM illian, the New Y ork 
Knicks forward and player represen­ tative. said, “ With one league now, there are more pressures on the indi­ vidual players. Guys haven't played against each other before and is just a lot of feeling out to see how much they can get away with.” 
Trinity netters win 

Continued from Page IG the match when Mike Newberry beat 
T rinity’s Dave Benson, 6-1, 6-1, and 
C harles Strode spanked Mike Davidson in straight sets by the sam e scores. 
G iam m alva and Gottfried defeated 
M anson and Lew is, 7-5, 6-2, in the num ber one doubles. 
But, it was McKown and Iskersky 

 that gave Trinity its deciding point. 
McKown and Iskersky heat New­ berry and Lucchesi, 6-4, 6-1, to give the 
T ig ers an in su rm o n ta b le 
6-2 advantage. 
Strode and Prince boat Davidson and 
Benson, 6-3. 4-6, and 6-3. 
Trinity m eets Popperdine at 2 p.m. 
Thursday. 

Edwards Bears down 

HOUSTON — Moses Malone scored 26 points and Rudy Tomjanovich added 24 to lead the Houston Rockets to a 12o-113 vic­ tory over the Los Angeles Lakers Wednes- dasy night. 

Bullets win in OT 
LANDOVER. Md. (A P )—Phil Chenier sank a 
16-foot jum p shot with eight seconds to plav in overtime Wednesday night to give the streaking 
Washington Bullets a 115-113 victory over the Denver 
Nuggets. 
Chenier scored eight of the Bullets’ IO points in the extra period and wound up with 31. 
Elvin Hayes, who had 4o points Sunday, poured in 
44 for the Bullets, who now have won four in a row to boost their Central Division leading record to 37-24. 
David Thompson led a torrid Denver rally in the fourth quarter, scoring his team ’s last 18 points. 
His three-point play with 24 seconds rem aining gave the N uggets a 1o5-1o3 lead , but Tom 
Henderson’s jum per sent the gam e into overtime. 
The Bullets took an 86-7o lead into the fourth period but a com bination of D enver’s pressing defense and Thom pson's eight-for eight shooting brought Denver back.

Pacers beat Braves 

R ockets 

Continued from Page IG leading BU rebounder with 7.4 caronic per game. 
“ I was very pleased with my year," 
Edwards adm itted. “ I am playing in­ side and a feel com fortable there. Also, 
Coach (Jim ) Haller has given me the green light to shoot whenever I am open. 
“ He has shown a lot of confidence in me and that in turn has given me a lot of confidence. He always assigns me to the opposition’s toughest player.” 
Edwards said the close loss to A&M and the defeat at SMU, the gam e in which Baylor led by 14, got the team down. 
“ We really were not weak defensi­ 

 vely.” he explained. “ It was .just that we m ade som e crucial m ental m is­ takes late in the gam e and wound up losing.” 
The 6-5, 24o-pounder said his beat gam e cam e in Baylor s 1o3-73 trium ph over SMU Feb. 15. He had a season- high 28 points and 14 rebounds. 
In last w eekend’s SWC first-round. 
72-7o victory over T exas, E d w ard s scored 21 points and had IO rebounds. 
“ To beat Tech,” Edwards said, his attention focusing on 
T hursdays gam e, “ We m ust shut down G rant 
Dukes and Mike Russell. I will proba­ bly guard Russell part of the gam e. 
“ I feel fit and ready to play. I can’t w ait.” 
Golden Gloves 

Continued from Page IG 
Thursday night’s lineup that match boxers with proven credentials. 
The W estside YMOA’s Alfredo Pas- tran , the defending regional junior flyweight cham p, will meet the parks and recreation dep artm en t’s G ilbert 
Favella in a featherweight m atch 
Fa vol la. is the defending Ju n io r 
O lym pics regional flyw eight c h a m ­ pion . 
G ilbert’s brother, Danny Favella, a regional lightweight titlist, will bump gloves with Lupe Rangel of the West­ side YMCA in'a welterweight battle. 
Local boxing coaches say, Rangel, 

 who boxed in the nov ice div ision a year ago, is probably the m ost im proved am ateur boxer in the city. 
Sammy Ayala, a national sem ifina­ list last year. will box in the light wel­ terw eight class, hut drew a bye for 
Thursday night. 

The Golden Gloves com petition is sanctioned by the A m ateur A thletic 
Union and will he judged under AAI rules. 
The only difference between the two organizations in this case, is the age lim itations imposed by the Golden 
Gloves.

Kings burn Nets 

UNIONDALE. N Y. (AP) - Sam Lacey scored 12 of his 2o points in the third quarter as the Kansas 
City Kings pulled away from the New York Nets en route to a 112-1oo victory Wednesday night. 
Lacey and Ron Boone scored four points apiece as 
Kansas City snapped a 4o-4o tie with IO consecutive points late in the second quarter to take a 52-41 halftime lead. 

INDIANAPOLIS (A P) - G uard Bill} Knight scored 27 [Mints and WU Jones added 2o to lead a woll balanced Indiana Pacer offense to a 11o-1o8 basketball victory over the Buffalo Braves Wednes- dav, 
The Pacers cemented the victory a four [sunt play, making it 93-87 with 934 rem aining in the game.

Bulls cool Suns 

PHOENIX, Ariz. (AP) — Wilbur Holland pumped in six overtune points, including a layup steal with 
-JO seconds lo go, to boost the Chicago Bulls to a 
1o8-1o4 win over the Phoenix Suns in National 
Basketball Association action Wednesday night. 
Holland had 2o [joints in the second half and led the Bulls in scoring honors for the evening with 28. 
It was the fifth consecutive victory for Chicago which now has a 29-34 record. 
Phoenix has a string of six losses and a record of 
28-35. 
Ttie Bulls held a 7o-68 lead going into the fourth quarter Th** learns battled through several ties and lead changes before the Suns’ Keith Erickson hit a 
19-footer with one second lo go. to tie it at 98-ail.

Limited warranty 
Sears paints, when applied according to directions, will cover any color with one coat (except rough or textured surfaces) where indicated by checkmark in the chart and have the qualities indicated for the years shown in the chart, or contact Sears and you get necessary additional paint or your money back. 

This warranty does not include labor or cost of labor for the application of any paint.
